text: vignette covers advanced features flowfabricr, including custom HTTP requests, error handling, working Arrow IPC data.
can use low-level HTTP helpers custom endpoints:
code: if (is_interactive) {   resp <- flowfabric_get("/healthz")   print(httr2::resp_body_json(resp)) } else {   cat('Skipping HTTP request: not running interactively.\n') } ## Skipping HTTP request: not running interactively.

text: API errors return structured JSON error. Use tryCatch handle errors gracefully:
code: if (is_interactive) {   tryCatch({     flowfabric_streamflow_query("bad-dataset", list())   }, error = function(e) {     message("API error: ", e$message)   }) } else {   cat('Skipping error handling example: not running interactively.\n') } ## Skipping error handling example: not running interactively.

text: data queries return Arrow tables. Convert data.frame needed: df <- .data.frame(tbl) vignette covers advanced features flowfabricr, including custom HTTP requests, error handling, working Arrow IPC data.
code: if (is_interactive) {   tbl <- flowfabric_streamflow_query("nwm-forecast", list(issue_time = "latest", scope = "features", feature_ids = c("101")))   df <- as.data.frame(tbl)   head(df) } else {   cat('Skipping Arrow IPC example: not running interactively.\n') } ## Skipping Arrow IPC example: not running interactively.

text: can use low-level HTTP helpers custom endpoints:
code: if (is_interactive) {   resp <- flowfabric_get("/healthz")   print(httr2::resp_body_json(resp)) } else {   cat('Skipping HTTP request: not running interactively.\n') } ## Skipping HTTP request: not running interactively.

text: API errors return structured JSON error. Use tryCatch handle errors gracefully:
code: if (is_interactive) {   tryCatch({     flowfabric_streamflow_query("bad-dataset", list())   }, error = function(e) {     message("API error: ", e$message)   }) } else {   cat('Skipping error handling example: not running interactively.\n') } ## Skipping error handling example: not running interactively.

text: data queries return Arrow tables. Convert data.frame needed: df <- .data.frame(tbl)
code: if (is_interactive) {   tbl <- flowfabric_streamflow_query("nwm-forecast", list(issue_time = "latest", scope = "features", feature_ids = c("101")))   df <- as.data.frame(tbl)   head(df) } else {   cat('Skipping Arrow IPC example: not running interactively.\n') } ## Skipping Arrow IPC example: not running interactively.

text: Authenticate per session:
code: is_interactive <- interactive() if (is_interactive) {   # This will obtain and cache a token for all API calls   flowfabric_token()  # triggers login if needed } else {   cat('Skipping authentication: not running interactively.\n') } ## Skipping authentication: not running interactively.

text: datasets <- flowfabric_list_datasets(token = token) can pass token directly API function:
code: token <- flowfabric_get_token() datasets <- flowfabric_list_datasets(token = token) print(datasets)

text: can use built-function obtain token interactively: token pass token directly API function: datasets <- flowfabric_list_datasets(token = “YOUR_TOKEN”)
code: if (is_interactive) {   token <- flowfabric_get_token()   print(token) } else {   cat('Skipping token retrieval: not running interactively.\n') } ## Skipping token retrieval: not running interactively. datasets <- flowfabric_list_datasets(token = "YOUR_TOKEN")

text: Tokens automatically refreshed expired, using underlying hfutils logic. See hfutils documentation advanced authentication options.

flowfabricr uses JWT Bearer authentication. default, manages token background using flowfabric_token(), leveraging hfutils package OAuth2 flows. can also set override token explicitly function call. ## Background (global) token Authenticate per session:
code: is_interactive <- interactive() if (is_interactive) {   # This will obtain and cache a token for all API calls   flowfabric_token()  # triggers login if needed } else {   cat('Skipping authentication: not running interactively.\n') } ## Skipping authentication: not running interactively.

text: datasets <- flowfabric_list_datasets(token = token) can pass token directly API function:
code: token <- flowfabric_get_token() datasets <- flowfabric_list_datasets(token = token) print(datasets)

text: can use built-function obtain token interactively: token pass token directly API function: datasets <- flowfabric_list_datasets(token = “YOUR_TOKEN”)
code: if (is_interactive) {   token <- flowfabric_get_token()   print(token) } else {   cat('Skipping token retrieval: not running interactively.\n') } ## Skipping token retrieval: not running interactively. datasets <- flowfabric_list_datasets(token = "YOUR_TOKEN")

text: Tokens automatically refreshed expired, using underlying hfutils logic. See hfutils documentation advanced authentication options.

title: Getting Started with flowfabricr
text: flowfabricr provides high-performance R interface FlowFabric REST API, including JWT authentication. vignette demonstrates basic usage expert R users. code examples wrapped \dontrun{} avoid accidental execution non-interactive environments.

title: Getting Started with flowfabricr
text: Authentication uses Bearer token. default, flowfabricr manages token background using flowfabric_token(). can also set override token explicitly function call.

title: Getting Started with flowfabricr
text: Authenticate per session:
code: if (is_interactive) {   # This will obtain and cache a token for all API calls   flowfabric_token()  # triggers login if needed } else {   cat('Skipping authentication: not running interactively.\n') } ## Skipping authentication: not running interactively.

title: Getting Started with flowfabricr
text: can pass token directly function: datasets <- flowfabric_list_datasets(token = token) See Authentication vignette details. datasets <- flowfabric_list_datasets() datasets
code: if (is_interactive) {   token <- flowfabric_get_token()   datasets <- flowfabric_list_datasets(token = token)   print(datasets) } else {   cat('Skipping dataset listing: not running interactively.\n') } ## Skipping dataset listing: not running interactively.

title: Getting Started with flowfabricr
text: est <- flowfabric_streamflow_estimate( dataset_id = “nwm-forecast”, params = list(issue_time = “latest”, scope = “features”, feature_ids = c(“101”)) ) est
code: \dontrun{ datasets <- flowfabric_list_datasets() datasets }

title: Getting Started with flowfabricr
text: tbl <- flowfabric_streamflow_query( dataset_id = “nwm-forecast”, params = list(issue_time = “latest”, scope = “features”, feature_ids = c(“101”)) ) .data.frame(tbl)
code: \dontrun{ est <- flowfabric_streamflow_estimate(   dataset_id = "nwm-forecast",   params = list(issue_time = "latest", scope = "features", feature_ids = c("101")) ) est }

title: Getting Started with flowfabricr
code: \dontrun{ tbl <- flowfabric_streamflow_query(   dataset_id = "nwm-forecast",   params = list(issue_time = "latest", scope = "features", feature_ids = c("101")) ) as.data.frame(tbl) }

title: R Client for FlowFabric API
text: flowfabricr powerful R client FlowFabric API, providing seamless access hydrologic forecasts, reanalysis, rating curves, datasets. robust authentication automatic token caching, can focus data science, data munging plumbing.

title: R Client for FlowFabric API
text: Evolving catalog harmonized data multiple models Single method access models - retrospective forecast One-time authentication: Log , token cached future use. Arrow IPC support: Fast, memory-efficient data transfer

title: R Client for FlowFabric API
code: #  Install from GitHub: devtools::install_github('lynker-spatial/flowfabric-r')

title: R Client for FlowFabric API
code: library(flowfabricr)  # 1. List available datasets datasets <- flowfabric_list_datasets() head(datasets)  # 2. Query streamflow forecast (first call prompts login, then caches token) # More on atuhentication below ... tbl <- flowfabric_streamflow_query(     dataset_id = "nws_owp_nwm_analysis",     feature_ids = c("101", "1001"),     issue_time = "latest" ) df <- as.data.frame(tbl) head(df)  # 3. Query streamflow reanalysis data tbl_re <- flowfabric_streamflow_query(   "nws_owp_nwm_reanalysis_3_0",   feature_ids = c("101", "1001"),   start_time = "2018-01-01",   end_time = "2018-01-31" )  # 4. Query ratings ```r ratings <- flowfabric_ratings_query(     feature_ids = c("101", "1001"),      type = "rem" )

title: R Client for FlowFabric API
text: Using platform requires authentication via Lynker Spatial Portal. Accounts free set use. use exceeds costs can burden reach power users better understand can help. get access, users can create account : https://proxy.lynker-spatial.com/ first API call prompt log via browser. token cached reused future calls—repeated browser prompts! Manual token refresh: Advanced: can always pass token explicitly:
code: flowfabric_refresh_token() # Forces re-authentication and updates cached token token <- hfutils::lynker_spatial_auth()$id_token tbl <- flowfabric_streamflow_query("nws_owp_nwm_analysis", feature_ids = c("101"), token = token)

title: R Client for FlowFabric API
text: see repeated browser prompts, call flowfabric_refresh_token() , retry queries. switch users, manually refresh token. Use verbose = TRUE endpoint detailed debug output.

title: R Client for FlowFabric API
text: See vignettes advanced usage, authentication, custom queries. API responses Arrow tables high-performance analytics.
